info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 06 at 3:36PM CDT until April 07 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR A PORTION OF THE SOUTHWEST PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM to 9 PM CDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham. * 20 Foot Winds...Northwest winds 25 to 39 mph with higher gusts Thursday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 8 to 10 percent Thursday. * Red Flag Threat Index...4 to 6 Thursday. * Timing...10 AM CDT Thursday through 9 PM CDT Thursday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
